Old Talon wasn't likely to get all the kills, but he'd chunk everyone down fairly well and apply stacks of BC to them all, helping the adc shred them down.  That was largely possible because of his blink making it possible for him to actually get in the middle of the fight to hit them all with his W and R, and with so much of his damage on his passive, he can't aoe burst so much with just W and R.

That being said, he does have stronger teamfight if you are able to proc your passive on multiple people and is better at cleaning up with his E.

IDK. I just liked the old talon better. I don't think it's fair to group everyone into a skill category simply because they aren't as good as you. New talon will never be as fun for me as the old one (new one is fun btw and I don't specifically want a full revert) simply because he doesn't have his blink anymore. He also feels less responsive because of the awkward timing restrictions placed on everything. (w blade recall, ulti double tap blade recall q dash feels pretty slow compared to other dashes, melee q feels wonky at long range {altho this could be fixed with a QOL fix} the aa reset on his q only works like 80% of the time and also fucks up animation cancels such as QR as it instantly destealths you like 20% of the time even if you spam ground click to prevent the aa reset)

Tbh I like new talons kit. There are just to many annoyances compared to the old one. Where the biggest annoyance was typically casting w and walking the wrong direction so they didn't get hit twice. 

If I want to play a champ that requires you to break the kit in order for it to work I have riven for that. (it's all coded in now but my point remains) 

Tldr I liked old talon because he felt significantly smoother and less of a hassle to play. And new talon responds wrong half the time even if you do input commands properly. And the new abilities. (specifically ultimate recall) feel really sluggish. 

*Edit* also juking melee range skillshots with talons old e requires more skill then the entire new talons kit. So maybe you don't want him reverted cause he was too hard.

the whole "camp bot after 6" bit from your previous post is a holdover from Old Talon in the first place.

> He had to work to get ahead.

Ignoring the fact that "so does new Talon" for a sec since you are insinuating he doesn't:

Old Talons "had to work to get ahead" because his lane phase was atrocious. Getting that first or second kill wasn't easy, (well, it depends on the matchup but generally it wasn't, but not only was it not easy for all the bad reasons, but from there it's basically autopilot outside of applying general game knowledge.

So that "work" basically only exists in the first few moments of the game.

Talon's laning was bad because His W was unfair to play against, so Riot made it into a mana bar drain and made his base stats garbage. Outside of W, Talon had near Zero way of interacting with the enemy. He was either pressing W all day or going in with E.

He had high scalings and garbage base despite being a snowball reliant champions and yet still managed to fall off late game due to his lack of meaningful or reliable outplay tools, and his only concrete form of skill expressing was dodging things with his E, wooptido. Pretty much everyone does that with Flash anyway.

By comparison, dodging things with his new E in effective ways actually takes as much if not more forethought and mechanical skill.

<_>

I'm just underwhelmed by Talon as a whole, old and new. Both iterations are extremely binary, ult reliant, and don't have meaningful ways to outplay opponents. I don't wish for him to have a Katarina-esque skill ceiling, but it would be nice if his kit revolved around more than "parkour in, one-shot single target, parkour away". It's not interesting, and honestly there just doesn't seem to be meaningful ways of skill-expression in his kit.
